metaDescription: Discover the profile of Md. Tawhid Anwar, a Senior Lecturer in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering at BRAC University. Explore his teaching philosophy, administrative roles, research, awards, and expertise in programming and CS education.

paragraphs: Md. Tawhid Anwar is a passionate educator and researcher, currently serving as a Senior Lecturer in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering at BRAC University. With both his B.Sc. and M.Sc. in CSE from BRAC University, Tawhid graduated with top honors, earning the Chancellor’s Gold Medal and being named Valedictorian of the 15th Convocation.

He brings years of experience in teaching and mentoring, starting as a Student Tutor and Student Mentor before transitioning to a full-time academic role. Tawhid is also the faculty co-advisor of the BRAC University Entrepreneurship Development Forum (BUEDF), where he helps foster leadership and innovation among students.

His dedication to impactful teaching was recognized with the University’s Best Teaching Award for extraordinary performance. Tawhid's research interests include Artificial Intelligence, Financial Market Analysis, and Machine Learning, and he is driven by a desire to contribute meaningfully to the academic and personal growth of his students.

experience.description: Teaches introductory programming courses (CSE110 & CSE111) in Java and Python. Also serves as Undergraduate Co-Coordinator and Course Coordinator.
Manages course offerings, scheduling, student support, and academic coordination for the CSE department.
